definition: to conceal/to hide away/to harbor/to store/to collect
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish

sentences.english: He succeeded in decoying the ducks toward his blind [hide].
sentences.chinese: 他成功地把野鴨引誘到他的隱藏處。

sentences.english: The clouds that comprise the Southern Equatorial Belt were gone when Jupiter emerged from its hiding place behind the sun last month.
sentences.chinese: 上個月在木星從太陽背後隱藏處顯露出來的時候。

sentences.english: I am certain it is the hideout my ancestors used so long ago.
sentences.chinese: 我肯定它是我的祖先那麼從前使用的隱藏處。

sentences.english: You have to flush the rabbits from their hiding place before you shoot them.
sentences.chinese: 你要打兔子首先要把它們從隱藏處驅趕出來。
